data.name: Successor License
descriptions: Presented to you by the High Houses in council, this small blue and white pin is an emblem of Successor diplomacy. Given to an alien such as yourself, it communicates their trust and confidence, and with it, their willingness to sell you their civilian-grade technology.

data.name: High Houses License
descriptions: The High Houses produce most of the advanced technology present in Successor space, and restrict its purchase to only those individuals and groups who support their interests. By aligning yourself with one of the houses, you have earned the right to purchase this exclusive technology.

data.name: "Byiaa" Shield Cortex
descriptions: At their peak, the Predecessors were feared not by how quickly they could overpower their enemies, but by how effectively they could outlast them. Many generations later, this philosophy is still reflected in modern Successor shield cortices, which are exceptionally powerful for their size but weaken the shield's resistance to incoming fire. This allows Successor ships to recover quickly from sustained damage, even if they are slightly more vulnerable to it.

data.name: "Ej" Shield Cortex
descriptions: Because their bimodal engines draw power from a ship's shield matrix, even non-combat Successor craft can justify equipping powerful shield generators to afford them greater mobility. This is the largest unit the High Houses permit for sale to the general public; even so, it offers substantially faster regeneration than even the largest human shield generators.

data.name: "Jaase" Shield Cortex
descriptions: The technology of their Predecessors was not nearly as modular as the modern Successor equivalents, which must be built with more limited resources and comparatively primitive manufacturing techniques. Nonetheless, this medium-sized shield cortex is powerful enough to shrug off the combined damage output of several lesser attackers, and consequently is reserved by the High Houses for use in their private navies.

data.name: "Jorv" Shield Cortex
descriptions: Bristling with regeneration nodes, this large Successor shield cortex requires a power budget greater than most human warships in their entirety. Many more traditional members of the High Houses disapprove of its design, arguing that such a powerful piece of their technology deserves a more artful form, but there has ultimately been little desire to invest time and money into a redesign for purely aesthetic reasons.

data.name: Shield Cortex Interface
descriptions: This compact tract of electrical fibers connects two Successor shield cortices to function as a single unit, preventing the shield-softening effect of one of the generators from unduly reducing the durability of the ship's shields at the cost of slightly reducing efficiency. The effect scales poorly past two connected generators.

data.name: 1-"Uurau" Betavoltaic Cell
descriptions: Unlike most radioisotope generators, this power cell operates by extracting electricity directly from beta particles produced by radioactive decay. While this process yields less energy per unit of material, it is also safer and produces very little waste heat.

data.name: OC-"Mavra" Betavoltaic Cell
descriptions: In an effort to produce a high-density power source smaller than their fusion reactors, the Successors have created this overcharged betavoltaic cell, which contains particularly high-density radioactive material and lacks much of the radiation shielding of the standard models. While it has technically passed safety inspection, most Successor pilots understandably prefer to keep a bulkhead between themselves and one of these potent little cores at all times.

data.name: 3-"Kaska" Betavoltaic Cell
descriptions: The Successors' betavoltaic generators are products of a time shortly after the collapse of their Predecessors' empire, one marked by scarcity and necessity. Their rugged designs did not appeal to traditional values of beauty, elegance, or uniqueness, but instead offered a level of reliability that made them very popular among those who were then struggling to survive.

data.name: 6-"Ruuv" Betavoltaic Cell
descriptions: This large modular betavoltaic generator is designed to be resilient and dependable: if one of its component cells fails, it can continue to operate at only a slightly reduced output. The Successors eschew its use on warships because of its low energy density, but it sees substantial use aboard their merchant, archaeological, and other civilian craft.

data.name: Auxiliary Power Reserve
descriptions: The relatively limited output of the Successors' betavoltaic cells has encouraged them to build efficient batteries to make up for that deficit. In order to gain some additional power overhead on their warships, these reserve a portion of their capacity exclusively for use by hull repair systems, effectively reducing the amount of power these systems draw from a ship's total energy pool while active.

data.name: Primary Power Reserve
descriptions: This larger Successor battery stores an impressive amount of energy, and can noticeably reduce the effective power draw of a ship's hull repair systems while in combat. The High Houses use this in concert with their reactors' power distribution systems to keep their warships powered and functional even when equipped with their most energy-hungry equipment. Even so, they do not restrict the sale of this unit to the general public.

data.name: "Nnesa" Fusion Core
descriptions: While betavoltaics may be sufficient for civilian use, the more advanced technology of the High Houses is energy-hungry enough to require more powerful generators. Rather than focusing on extracting as much power from as little space as possible, the High Houses have designed these stellarator fusion reactors for efficiency and portability; they produce little heat and few waste byproducts. In addition, they are designed to channel power more efficiently to a ship's defensive systems, manifested as a reduction in the power draw of the associated outfits.

data.name: "Ryuit" Fusion Core
descriptions: Like most Successor technology, their modern reactors are based on similar ones secreted away by the High Houses during the collapse of the Predecessors' empire. Even though their modern efforts don't quite match the potency of their ancestors', the designs retain an aura of elegance and power, twisting like flames and humming with energy.

One also can't help but wonder about those few original reactors, which presumably remain locked away in the private vaults of the High Houses, kept in prime condition for if and when they are needed once again.

data.name: "Uoret" Fusion Core
descriptions: Designed in the form of a flowering plant from the ancestral homeworld of the Successors, this largest and most powerful of the High Houses' stellarators demonstrates a mastery of nuclear fusion power far exceeding humanity's. In addition to being powerful and surprisingly efficient, it is also supported by a large and well-integrated power distribution network capable of massively reducing the draw of the Successors' energy-hungry defensive outfits.

data.name: Successor Cooling
descriptions: Like much of their technology, Successor cooling is bimodal, running a constant low-flow coolant loop that can be increased in both volume and heat rejection when the situation demands it.

data.name: Successor Fuel Sail
descriptions: The Successors maintain a strong connection to their maritime tradition, exemplified in this strangely rustic fuel collector. The sail expands to a vast area when in the vicinity of a stellar corona, gently collecting hydrogen from it and condensing it into a ship's fuel storage in a fashion much more elegant than the comparatively brutish action of a traditional ramscoop. Pilots should note, however, that the large surface area of the deployed sail also absorbs a lot of heat.

data.name: "Veldt" Combat Scanner
descriptions: The High Houses prefer to keep their territories well-monitored, and have a long history of developing powerful and efficient scanners to that end. This scanning system is their latest generation, used to both identify contraband and target potential foes at great distance.
While restricted for sale to the public, the sheer number of scanners produced has allowed a few to slip onto black markets; a persistent problem the High Houses are extremely eager to correct.

data.name: "Tuur" Scanning Suite
descriptions: This scanning system was developed during the first years after the Predecessors' collapse, when the newly emigrated High Houses needed to find new resource deposits to replace those that they had left behind. While less efficient than human scanners, it is compact and powerful, useful for identifying materials both in asteroids and planetside.

In the modern day, with the territories of the High Houses more or less static, these scanners are primarily used either by researchers as tools for planetary analysis or by independent pilots supporting themselves via asteroid mining.

data.name: "Niis" Inductive Engines
descriptions: This tiny set of inductive engines is just enough to push around a Successor shuttle. They retain the dual-mode capabilities of the larger models, albeit at a much smaller scale.

data.name: "Aqra" Inductive Thruster
descriptions: Successor thrusters are bimodal: most of the time, they are run in an energy-efficient low-power state, but when the time comes to flee or fight, they can be switched to a less efficient but very powerful high-thrust mode that draws power from the ship's shields.

data.name: "Aqra" Inductive Steering
descriptions: Since their steering thrusters lack the mode switch emblematic of their linear propulsion, the Successors have invested their efforts into making these thrusters both powerful for their size and relatively efficient. In addition, recurrent power streams from the steering thrusters feed back into the ship's linear engines during afterburning modes, reducing or even reversing the additional energy cost associated with using afterburners.

data.name: "Aqra" Inductive Reverser
descriptions: The inductive thruster technology used by the Successors is most similar to the ion thrusters used in human space, but the more powerful magnetic fields utilized by these thrusters lets them generate substantially more thrust than any comparable human ion thruster.
Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.

data.name: "Chyyra" Inductive Thruster
descriptions: This larger set of inductive thrusters is impressively efficient under low power, and produces an equally impressive amount of thrust in its high-power mode. With these, even large and apparently lumbering Successor ships can suddenly become substantially more agile when under threat.

data.name: "Chyyra" Inductive Steering
descriptions: While not particularly powerful for its size, this set of inductive steering engines is extraordinarily efficient, allowing large Successor vessels to remain relatively nimble even when equipped with very small generators.

data.name: "Chyyra" Inductive Reverser
descriptions: This large reverse thruster sees use in both commerce and warfare, speeding up the traversal of trade routes in the former situation and enhancing combat agility in the latter.
Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.

data.name: "Veusa" Inductive Thruster
descriptions: The largest of the Successors' pulsed inductive thrusters, the Veusa is used primarily to propel their large warships and freighters. While its high-performance mode is powerful enough to accelerate even the largest vessels to high speeds, it also drains shield power remarkably quickly; this is clearly meant to be paired with one of the Successors' fast-recharging shield generators.

data.name: "Veusa" Inductive Steering
descriptions: The Veusa series of Successor steering units is significantly smaller than comparable human engines, allowing the Successors to gain some flexibility in the engine layouts of their large ships.

data.name: "Veusa" Inductive Reverser
descriptions: While the invertebrate Successors are relatively unaffected, human pilots must take care when using a reverse thruster this large to avoid dangerous g-force stress on the body.
Because a reverse thruster must be facing forwards, it must be installed in the weapon section of your ship instead of the engine section.

data.name: Multimodal Armor: Light
descriptions: The metamaterial armor of Successor warships can be altered in an appropriately equipped spaceport to change its attributes.
This configuration introduces well-ordered nanoscale voids into the armor's structure, reducing a warship's mass without compromising structural integrity.

data.name: Multimodal Armor: Heavy
descriptions: The metamaterial armor of Successor warships can be altered in an appropriately equipped spaceport to change its attributes.
This configuration strengthens the bonds between the atoms making up the armor, increasing its resistance to direct damage.

data.name: Multimodal Armor: Regen
descriptions: The metamaterial armor of Successor warships can be altered in an appropriately equipped spaceport to change its attributes.
This configuration increases the plasticity of the armor, greatly increasing the effectiveness of in-combat repair efforts.

data.name: Multimodal Armor: Keystone
descriptions: The metamaterial armor of Successor warships can be altered in an appropriately equipped spaceport to change its attributes.
This configuration allows a vessel equipped with it to safely pass through unstable wormholes. As a side effect, it also substantially interferes with external scans of a vessel's cargo or outfits.

data.name: Kinetic Rail Rifle
descriptions: While projectile weapons of this scale are considered obsolete in human space, having been superseded by laser weaponry, the Successors' generations of experience with high-power kinetic weapons have allowed them to produce this particularly terrifying railgun rifle, firing projectiles capable of piercing body armor and even intervening bulkheads. Particularly effective at repelling boarders, it is capable of interfacing with a Successor ship's computer and surveillance systems, routing target information to a built-in display.

data.name: "Ojet" Bimodal Coilgun
descriptions: Precise and deadly, the Ojet Bimodal Coilgun has been the High Houses' armament of choice since long before humans ever took to the stars. It was designed quite simply as a perfect weapon; it is said that by the time the empire of the Predecessors fell, they had seen no need to install any other weapon on their ships for over a thousand years.

The Ojet fires hyperdense packets of charged particles that disperse as they travel: up close the concentrated bolt pierces armor, while at a distance the ionic spray destabilizes shielding. Together, a ship equipped with these weapons can adjust its damage profile just by changing its engagement range, allowing it to be highly effective against any foe.

data.name: Bimodal Coilgun Turret
descriptions: Successor warships have traditionally relied on fixed weaponry to deal with their foes, but the High Houses do produce a turreted platform for the Ojet Coilgun so that their larger and slower vessels can maintain their combat effectiveness against more maneuverable targets. It mounts two of the weapons side by side, rigged to fire double the amount of shots per burst to keep them in sync with the fixed hardpoints.

data.name: Drag Cannon
descriptions: The Successors have a historical affinity for projectile weaponry which persists to the modern day. The Drag Cannon fires a short-ranged, highly inaccurate blast of projectiles that not only deal substantial damage but also temporarily disrupt the target's engines.

While it is an inelegant design in comparison to the time-tested Ojet Coilgun, and consequently less appreciated, the Drag Cannon has found a place on the Successors' fast attack craft primarily as a tool for slowing down enemy vessels so that they can be engaged by a larger fleet.

data.name: Successor Pulse Laser
descriptions: This shield-penetrating laser is one of the few weapons manufactured independently in Successor space, rather than under the auspices and restrictions of the High Houses. As a consequence of this, it is neither especially powerful nor efficient, but its low cost and space requirements make it a nonetheless relatively appealing defensive choice for those without access to the High Houses' more potent weaponry.

data.name: Pulse Laser Turret
descriptions: The introduction of the Pulse Laser was a wake-up call for the more astute in the High Houses, as it was the first time in hundreds of years that weapons were being manufactured by groups other than themselves. Most Successors see the turreted version as a continuation of this democratization of violence, while the more paranoid claim that the High Houses have infiltrated production and intentionally sabotaged the design.

data.name: Overcharged Pulse Laser
descriptions: Unable to access large quantities of the high-quality weaponry produced by the High Houses, the People's Houses have had to work with what is available to them: mostly the relatively low-powered pulse lasers produced independently in Successor space. This pulse laser has had its safeties bypassed and its optics upgraded, allowing it to do more damage to shields at a lower power cost in exchange for producing substantially more heat.

data.name: Overcharged Laser Turret
descriptions: Hand-crafted by the more colorful members of the People's Houses, this bespoke overcharged Pulse Laser turret has had even more power pumped into its laser generator compared to the fixed version, producing a truly prodigious amount of heat for a weapon of its size. Despite its inelegant design, it is nonetheless a fearsome weapon, especially considering that it retains the ability to partially punch through shielding.

data.name: "Sjeja" Kinetic Lance
descriptions: The largest and most powerful of the Successors' modern weapons, this massive superconducting coilgun is elegant in its simplicity, cleanly perforating targets at extreme range. Although the weapon requires a substantial burst of power in order to fire, it is capable of storing some of this within the coils themselves, allowing it to be fired without additional battery banks at the cost of inflicting a lingering power draw on the ship's systems.
Ammunition for this weapon can be restocked at any outfitter.

data.name: High-Velocity Spike
descriptions: The projectiles fired by the Sjeja Kinetic Lance are too large to be synthesized on-the-fly from the ship's reserves, and must be carried separately.

data.name: High-Velocity Spike Rack
descriptions: Though the built-in ammunition reserves of the Sjeja Kinetic Lance are sufficient for all but the most protracted engagements, the High Houses do manufacture this additional storage unit for use on their largest warships. The rack includes a small set of batteries to help support the high power costs of the Sjeja.
